title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The point is earned for the correct answer of −5. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaI1aGaaiOlaaaa@3590@

The response can earn the point without showing any supporting work: the correct answer is enough.

Even with a correct answer, a response that includes false claims (“says too much”) will not earn the point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

The point is earned by stating that x=−3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcqGHsislcaaIZaaaaa@36FF@ is a critical point.

Second point:

Eligibility: The response must earn the first point to be eligible for the second point.

The second point is earned, for example, by a statement like “g changes from positive to negative at x=−3. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@37B1@ ”

This verification requires the explicit connection of h′=g. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3863@ The point cannot be earned for “ h ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgagaqbaaaa@344B@ changes from positive to negative at x=−3. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@37B1@ ”

A response of “ h ′ =g, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@370C@ and h ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgagaqbaaaa@344B@ changes from positive to negative at x=−3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcqGHsislcaaIZaaaaa@36FF@ ” would earn the second point. Note: The connection “ h ′ =g MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgapaGbauaapeGaeyypa0Jaam4zaaaa@365C@ ” might have been made in part (a). Whenever the connection is made, it carries through the rest of this problem.

Language like “g changes at x=−3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcqGHsislcaaIZaaaaa@36FF@ ” is ambiguous and will not earn the point.

Words such as “the graph” are interpreted to be referring to g, the graph given in the prompt.

The terms “the function” or “the derivative” are ambiguous and cannot earn this point.

Third point:

This requires justifying x=−3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcqGHsislcaaIZaaaaa@36FF@ as the location of an absolute maximum.

Eligibility: The response must earn the second point to be eligible for the third point.

The response may earn the third point by appealing to the uniqueness of the critical point at x=−3. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@37B1@ For example: “ x=−3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcqGHsislcaaIZaaaaa@36FF@ is the only critical point of h in the interval [ −8,   6 ], MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D6C@ so the maximum there has to be an absolute maximum.”

The point is not earned for, “ h ′ =g MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgapaGbauaapeGaeyypa0Jaam4zaaaa@365C@ is positive to the left of x=−3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcqGHsislcaaIZaaaaa@36FF@ and negative to the right of x=−3. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@37B1@ ” It’s not clear whether this refers to all points to the left and right of x=−3, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@37AF@ or only to points near x=−3. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@37B1@

Alternate solution: Candidates Test

The absolute maximum will occur at a critical point where h ′  ( x )=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A41@ or at an endpoint.

h ′  ( x )=g ( x )=0  ⇒  x=−3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4CC6@

h ( −8 )=−8, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C8C@ h ( −3 )= 3 2 , MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C61@ and h ( 6 )=−10−4π, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FB8@ so the absolute maximum of h is at x=−3. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@37B1@

The first point is earned by considering x=−3. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@37B1@

The second point is earned by stating that the absolute maximum occurs at x=−3. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@37B1@

The third point is earned by presenting the correct values or signs of h ( −8 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39D7@ h ( −3 ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39D2@ and h ( 6 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38EA@

General comments:

Intervals and inequalities may be stated with or without endpoints included, e.g., [ −8,  3 ] MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B56@ or ( −8,  3 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3BBF@

“Typographical” errors such as “ h ′  ( x )=g ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3EC4@ ” will not be penalized.

A response that contains false statements (“says too much”), no matter how many, will fail to earn only one of the points that would otherwise be earned in this part.

Look out for ‘wrong derivative’ errors! For example: A response stating that “g changes from increasing to decreasing at x=−3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcqGHsislcaaIZaaaaa@36FF@ ” is not a correct justification of a maximum.

The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

The point is earned for listing the x-values − 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaMi8UaaGinaaaa@366E@ and 2.

All of the justification is wrapped up in the second point.

If other candidates are mentioned, they must be ruled out by valid reasoning.

The points of inflection for the graph of h are not ( − 4,  3 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CB9@ and ( 2,   −5 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C4C@ (these are points on the graph of g). Responses that make this claim will not earn the first point, but might still earn the second point.

Second point:

This point requires the connection h′=g. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3863@ Remember that the connection may have been made in a previous part.

Eligibility: The response must identify the x-coordinate of at least one of the correct points of inflection and no incorrect x-values to be eligible for the second point.

The justification must be in terms of g. Statements about h are formulas, not applied to our problem.

The point is earned for the following responses:

· g changes from increasing to decreasing or vice versa at these points.

· g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadEgagaqbaaaa@344A@ changes from positive to negative or vice versa at these points.

· g has a relative maximum or minimum at these points.

The point is not earned for the following responses:

· h changes concavity at x=− 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3891@ and x=2. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaIYaGaaiOlaaaa@36C3@

· h ′ ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGObGbauGbauaaaaa@3436@ changes sign at x=− 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaeyOeI0IaaGjcVlaaisdaaaa@3871@ and x=2. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaIYaGaaiOlaaaa@36C3@

· Claims that g ′  ( − 4 )=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C60@ or g ′  ( 2 )=0. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A92@ These values do not exist.

· A response that claims g ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbauaaaaa@342A@ changes from increasing to decreasing.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

The point is earned for differentiating k correctly, whether evaluated at x=1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaadIhacqGH9aqpcaaIXaaaaa@3610@ or not.

This “chain rule” point can also be earned by using the product rule.

Second point:

The correct answer is 60.This answer does not need to be simplified but if it is, the simplification must be correct.

The response “ 10( −3 )( −2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B6A@ ” without other supporting work earns the answer point, but does not show enough computation to earn the chain rule point. In all other cases, the response must earn the first point to be eligible for the second point.

It is not necessary to simplify numeric answers.

The response 10 ⋅ g ( 1 ) ⋅  g ′  ( 1 )=10( −3 )( −2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@523B@ earns both points.

The response 10 ⋅ g ( 1 ) ⋅  g ′  ( 1 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@495B@ earns the first point, but not the second. The student must evaluate g and g ′ . MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbauaacaGGUaaaaa@34DC@
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

The point is earned by conveying that both the numerator and denominator each approach 0.

The response does not need to reference continuity or differentiability.

Responses including “ limit= 0 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AC8@ ” will not earn the first point.

Note: 0 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3514@ may appear in disguise, as in “ limit= h ( − 4 ) 2( − 4 )+8 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@48AC@ ”

Responses that include this will not earn the first point.

Other presentations of the limits, such as “ → 0 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3701@ ” or “ = indeterminate form  0 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@47D3@ ” will earn the first point.

Simply evaluating the numerator and denominator separately will earn this point since both are continuous functions.

Second point:

The point is earned by presenting a limit of a fraction whose numerator and denominator are clearly attempts at derivatives of h ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3875@ and 2x+8 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaaikdacaWG4bGaey4kaSIaaGioaaaa@36AF@ respectively.

The point may be earned even if the limit notation is missing from some expressions, but it cannot be earned if the response never expresses anything we recognize as a limit.

Third point:

The point is earned for the correct answer, which equals 3 2 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@35CB@ The answer does not need to be simplified.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

The point is earned by presenting numeric expressions identifiable as attempts to compute area.

Second point:

The point is earned for the correct answer, which equals − 6, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaMi8UaaGOnaiaacYcaaaa@3720@ supported by appropriate work. The answer does not need to be simplified.

The answer “ 3 2 − 3 2 −6, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@39AE@ ” by itself, earns both points.

The unsupported answer “ − 6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaMi8UaaGOnaaaa@3670@ ” does not earn either point.

title: Part G
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

The point is earned for the sum of the series: 36r 1−r . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3965@

The sum may appear in other forms, for example, 36 1−r −36. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AD8@ (The constant may be moved to the other side of the equation before the sum appears in closed form.)

Second point:

This point is earned for finding the value of r that is consistent with the answer for h ( 2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGObGaaGjcVpaabmaabaGaaGOmaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaaa@37F5@ found in part (f).

Eligibility: The response must earn the first point to be eligible for the second point.

The correct answer r=− 1 5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3804@ earns the point if the correct answer − 6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiabgkHiTiaayIW7caaI2aaaaa@3690@ is given in part (f).

An answer a>−18 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@37AA@ in part (f) is consistent with r= a 36+a . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A7A@

An answer a≤−18 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3857@ in part (f) is consistent with no solution (since |  r  |≥1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D2D@ ).

If no answer appears in part (f), the point cannot be earned unless h ( 2 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3834@ is computed in part (g).

title: Part H
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The point is earned for the answer “no” with the reason that g is not differentiable.

The response doesn’t need to name the interval. If an interval is presented, it can be open or closed, but cannot contradict the graph of g.

The response must name g, or “the graph,” as the function that is non-differentiable. The name h ′ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgagaqbaaaa@344B@ is sufficient if the connection h ′ =g MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiqadIgapaGbauaapeGaeyypa0Jaam4zaaaa@365C@ has been made earlier.

title: Part I
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

First point:

The response earns the point by referring to arc length, or by working with the arc length of some portion of a circle.

Use your judgment to determine whether or not the response conveys an attempt to compute the length of the curve.

Second point:

The point is earned for the correct answer 2π, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaaikdacqaHapaCcaGGSaaaaa@367B@ supported by appropriate reasoning.

The unsupported answer 2π MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaaikdacqaHapaCaaa@35CB@ does not earn the point.

Alternate solution:

On the interval [ 2,  6 ], MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3B55@ we have:

g ( x )=−1− 16− ( x−2 ) 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43FC@

g ′  ( x )= x−2 16− ( x−2 ) 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4467@

1+ ( g ′  ( x ) ) 2 = 16 16− ( x−2 ) 2 = 1 1− ( x−2 4 ) 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5186@

∫ 2 6 1+ ( g ′  ( x ) ) 2   dx = 4 sin −1  ( x−2 4 )  |  2  6 =4 sin −1  ( 1 )−4 sin −1  ( 0 )=2π MathType@MTEF@5@5@@746D@

This alternate solution earns the first point for an antiderivative of the form A sin −1  ( u )+C, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F9A@ where

· A is a nonzero real number,

· C may be an arbitrary constant, or any real number, or may be omitted, and

· u may be indeterminate or a declared function of x.

The second point is earned for the correct answer 2π, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbiaaikdacqaHapaCcaGGSaaaaa@367B@ supported by appropriate reasoning.
